parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (13240044) at the end.  This strongly suggests an intention to promote a specific candidate.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly refers to Dragos-Gabriel Zisopol, a candidate for the Uniunea Elena din Romania party. The image clearly shows his picture and the text explicitly mentions his name and the party. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, targeting a wide audience. The use of hashtags (#UniuneaElenaDinRomania #DragosGabrielZisopol #Vot2024) further indicates an attempt to reach a broad public. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to facilitate voting for Dragos-Gabriel Zisopol.  The content provides a guide to locate his position on the ballot paper, clearly aiming to increase his votes. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. While it provides information, its purpose is not impartial reporting but rather persuasive promotion of a candidate. It lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected from journalistic content.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a structured campaign message designed to influence voters' choices.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>383031788155206</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It directly refers to a specific candidate (Dragos-Gabriel Zisopol), uses paid advertising on a public platform to reach a wide audience, and has the clear objective of influencing voters to choose this candidate. The presence of a CMF number further reinforces this conclusion. The post's content, while presented as a helpful guide, ultimately serves as a promotional tool for the candidate.  The timing of the post (after the official campaign period) is also a crucial factor.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Dragos-Gabriel Zisopol</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Uniunea Elena din Romania</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Uniunea Elenă din România, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu ID-ul postării 383031788155206, care promovează candidatul Dragos-Gabriel Zisopol pentru alegerile parlamentare, având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea acestuia. Postarea, deși prezentată sub forma unui ghid, conține un CMF (13240044), indicând clar natura sa de propagandă electorală.  Textul și imaginea postării fac referire explicită la candidatul Zisopol și la Uniunea Elenă din România, având ca obiectiv creșterea numărului de voturi pentru acesta.  Reclama a avut o estimare a impactului de peste 1 milion de oameni, conform datelor din Ad Library, cu o cheltuială de sub 100 RON.  Contactul advertiserului este electorale@uniunea-elena.ro și +40760673009.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
